title.narrative: Self financially sustainable business through sunflower production and processing of cooking oil

description.narrative:
Petauke District Farmers Association was legally registered in 2004 with a membership of about 500 farmers and overtime has shown growth in its membership to 6,000 individual farmers. However, only about 500 members had renewed their membership in 2017. The association covers the whole district in terms of its operation with 150 Information Centers. Each information centre pays an affiliation fee for it to actively participate in the affairs of the association. The greatest benefit of members in the association is capacity building, Lima Credit Scheme and Market for sunflower. The association has trained 450 members in poultry management through the poultry business matching grant awarded by the Zambian government through the Ministry of Agriculture. They have also conducted trainings in bee keeping.The association provides Lima credit scheme to members where members pay 50% to the association and the last 50% after harvest. The association makes ZMW 100 per hectare as facilitation fee of the Lima Credit Scheme. As part of the sustainability strategy, the association decided to develop and submit a concept to United States Development of Africa – USDF to process cooking oil from sunflower which they have been funded. The association has been running this business for over a year and have since managed by acquire its own land and built processing plant and office premises. The desire by the association is to diverse their income sources as a way of increasing their capital base and reducing on donor dependency. The association also realizes the need to increase its membership base as it has an impact on their revenue, however the association sees the need to provide more membership services to its members as a way of proving its relevance need for members to affiliate. The association also sees the need to improve on accountability and business planning.
The association is currently running a number of businesses ranging from piggery where they breed piglets. They also have a chicken breeding centre where they hatch chicks of a certain breed and sell the chicks to members and non-members. The association also owns a tractor which they rent out for tillage and haulage to both members and non- members. As part of the sustainability strategy, the association decided to develop and submit a concept to United States Development of Africa – USADF to process cooking oil from sunflower which they have been funded and the project is now running. The association has been running this business for over a year and have since managed to acquire its own land and built processing plant and office premises.
To become self sustaintable through crop & Livestock diversification, Improve sunflower outgrower scheme and increase membership base by 333 monthly as a way of increasing their capital base and reducing on donor dependency.
